body:
It actually looks like all copyto isn't working with encrypted remote. It stores the file in an encrypted file outside of the Vault/ Root that is set:

```
rclone --config /etc/rclone/rclone.conf copyto '/data/.Local/Shows/Arrow/Season 02/Arrow - S02E03 - Broken Dolls [480p, x264, AAC, HDTV].mp4' ACD_VAULT:Media/Shows/test.mp4 -vvvvvv --stats 30s --crypt-show-mapping
2017/03/12 08:01:26 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.35-164-g488353cβ" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--config" "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf" "copyto" "/data/.Local/Shows/Arrow/Season 02/Arrow - S02E03 - Broken Dolls [480p, x264, AAC, HDTV].mp4" "ACD_VAULT:Media/Shows/test.mp4" "-vvvvvv" "--stats" "30s" "--crypt-show-mapping"]
2017/03/12 08:01:26 DEBUG : ACD: Saved new token in config file
2017/03/12 08:01:27 INFO  : Encrypted amazon drive root 'Vault/dmi0e2fbj6btggkj33t5dtqmo4/j4jctgmgj50nsvqtbd2gb0o8ig': Modify window not supported
2017/03/12 08:01:27 DEBUG : Arrow - S02E03 - Broken Dolls [480p, x264, AAC, HDTV].mp4: Sizes identical
2017/03/12 08:01:27 DEBUG : Arrow - S02E03 - Broken Dolls [480p, x264, AAC, HDTV].mp4: Unchanged skipping
2017/03/12 08:01:27 INFO  :
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:       800ms
2017/03/12 08:01:27 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 11
2017/03/12 08:01:27 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.35-164-g488353cβ" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "--config" "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf" "copyto" "/data/.Local/Shows/Arrow/Season 02/Arrow - S02E03 - Broken Dolls [480p, x264, AAC, HDTV].mp4" "ACD_VAULT:Media/Shows/test.mp4" "-vvvvvv" "--stats" "30s" "--crypt-show-mapping"]
```

rclone.conf:
```
[ACD_VAULT]
type = crypt
remote = ACD:Vault
filename_encryption = standard
***REST OMITTED***
```

It looks like if you do not include a root slash in the target the above will happen.

So instead of ACD_VAULT:Media (which is what I typically use), if I use ACD_VAULT:/Media everything seems to work ok.
Actually it looks like this happens ANY time the destination directory doesn't already exist. Once the destination directory is created it seems to work as expected.

I've managed to confirm this.

It doesn't seem to need a space in the filename.  This seems to go wrong on google drive too
```
$ rclone -vv copyto hello.txt secretacd:non-exist-dir/hello2.txt
$ rclone ls secretacd:non-exist-dir
2017/03/13 12:07:47 Failed to ls: directory not found
$ rclone lsl --max-depth 1 acd:
       54 2017-03-13 11:51:05.755000000 gttofhvjcn6226aka4trpppv4k
```

This also goes wrong without crypt

```
$ rclone -vv copyto hello.txt acd:non-exist-dir/hello2.txt
2017/03/13 12:09:14 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.35-169-g320c53e" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "copyto" "hello.txt" "acd:non-exist-dir/hello2.txt"]
2017/03/13 12:09:15 INFO  : amazon drive root 'non-exist-dir': Modify window not supported
2017/03/13 12:09:15 DEBUG : hello.txt: Couldn't find file - need to transfer
2017/03/13 12:09:16 INFO  : hello.txt: Copied (new)
2017/03/13 12:09:16 INFO  : 
Transferred:      6 Bytes (5 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:        1.1s
2017/03/13 12:09:16 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 12
2017/03/13 12:09:16 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.35-169-g320c53e" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "copyto" "hello.txt" "acd:non-exist-dir/hello2.txt"]
$ rclone ls acd:non-exist-dir
2017/03/13 12:09:25 Failed to ls: directory not found
$ rclone lsl --max-depth 1 acd:
        6 2017-03-13 12:09:15.951000000 hello2.txt
```

rename.from: Problem with spaces in remote encrypted directories (quoted pathnames)
rename.to: copyto places files in incorrect place for non-existent directory

body:
I can confirm this is happening with the mount command as well.

I mounted ACD_VAULT:Media

```
rclone mount "ACD_VAULT:Media" "/data/.Vault"
```

```
[ACD_VAULT]
type = crypt
remote = ACD:TEST
filename_encryption = off
password = ***
password2 = ***
```

```
ls ACD:
TEST (Empty)
```

So the TEST was there (the root of the CRYPT), but the Media directory in TEST was missing.

Running the command:
```
echo 123 > abc
```

Resulted in:
```
ls ACD:
TEST (Empty)
abc.bin
```

This should fix all the above!  If it doesn't, please re-open.

http://beta.rclone.org/v1.35-174-g9b07d32/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks Nick. I'll give it a try later today.

```
+ /usr/local/bin/rclone mount ACD_VAULT:/Media /data/.Vault --config /etc/rclone/rclone.conf -v --max-read-ahead 200M --buffer-size 200M --allow-other
runtime: failed to create new OS thread (have 2 already; errno=22)
fatal error: newosproc

runtime stack:
runtime.throw(0x814023, 0x9)
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/panic.go:596 +0x70
runtime.newosproc(0x1442002a000, 0x1442003a000)
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/os_linux.go:163 +0x164
runtime.newm(0x848e20, 0x0)
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/proc.go:1628 +0x110
runtime.main.func1()
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/proc.go:126 +0x28

	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/asm_arm64.s:241 +0x90
runtime.mstart()
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/proc.go:1132

goroutine 1 [running]:

```

Running 174 beta. 164 doesn't throw in the same container.

> runtime: failed to create new OS thread (have 2 already; errno=22)

Looks like the container is limiting the number of threads?  rclone can potentially use lots of threads.

No limit on threads. Also, exact same container using 164, never have a
problem (tons and tons of different type of IO last couple of weeks 20+ TB).

Can you describe exactly how you are running the binary in the ticket too please?

issue.title: Failed to create new OS thread

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Spawned from #1231 

Running the rclone using a process manager that runs the following command:
```
/usr/local/bin/rclone mount ACD_VAULT:/Media /data/.Vault --config /etc/rclone/rclone.conf -v --max-read-ahead 200M --buffer-size 200M --allow-other &
wait $!
```

Using version 174 I get this output:
```
/usr/local/bin/rclone mount ACD_VAULT:/Media /data/.Vault --config /etc/rclone/rclone.conf -v --max-read-ahead 200M --buffer-size 200M --allow-other
runtime: failed to create new OS thread (have 2 already; errno=22)
fatal error: newosproc

runtime stack:
runtime.throw(0x814023, 0x9)
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/panic.go:596 +0x70
runtime.newosproc(0x1442002a000, 0x1442003a000)
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/os_linux.go:163 +0x164
runtime.newm(0x848e20, 0x0)
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/proc.go:1628 +0x110
runtime.main.func1()
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/proc.go:126 +0x28
runtime.systemstack(0xccdd00)
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/asm_arm64.s:241 +0x90
runtime.mstart()
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/proc.go:1132

goroutine 1 [running]:
runtime.systemstack_switch()
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/asm_arm64.s:190 +0x8 fp=0x14420026780 sp=0x14420026770
runtime.main()
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/proc.go:127 +0x58 fp=0x144200267d0 sp=0x14420026780
runtime.goexit()
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.8.linux.amd64/src/runtime/asm_arm64.s:981 +0x4 fp=0x144200267d0 sp=0x144200267d0
```

Rolling back to version 164 eliminated  the issue.

This is in a docker container based on Ubuntu.
